intro: Pabstia viridis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered green pabstia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. This variety is notable for its compact size and adaptability to dry, sandy soils.
